sentences: Elliot Brett Levine (born September 28, 1963, Washington, D.C., United States) is an American pianist and keyboardist.
He had two record releases on the Nashville-based Artifex records label between 1999 and 2004.
In March 2012 he was the first person to use an iPad Keytar, an iPad with a guitar strap, in a live performance posted to YouTube.
Levine has toured with Wilson Pickett and Heatwave (Always & Forever/Boogie Nights).
In 2003, he scored the music to an Emmy nominated documentary, "Teens in Between".
His music was also used on "Inside the NBA" on TBS (TV Channel) (2001), as well as an independent college movie, "Friends With Benefits" (2003).
He currently tours in the United States as a member of Heatwave.
